star.name: Sun
star.description: The star at the center of our solar system, providing light and energy for all the planets.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The closest planet to the Sun, known for extreme temperatures and lack of atmosphere.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: The second planet from the Sun, known for its thick clouds and scorching temperatures.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: The third planet from the Sun, teeming with diverse life forms and abundant water.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: The fourth planet from the Sun, often referred to as the 'Red Planet' due to its surface color.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: The largest planet in the solar system, known for its massive size and swirling storms.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Famous for its stunning ring system, Saturn is a gas giant and the sixth planet from the Sun.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is an ice giant and the seventh planet from the Sun, with a unique sideways rotation.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: The farthest planet from the Sun, Neptune is another ice giant and has a vibrant blue color.

moons.name: Moon
moons.description: Earth's natural satellite, responsible for tides and providing a source of inspiration for humanity.

moons.name: Phobos
moons.description: One of Mars' two moons, named after the Greek god Phobos (Fear).

moons.name: Deimos
moons.description: The smaller moon of Mars, named after the Greek god Deimos (Terror).

moons.name: Io
moons.description: One of Jupiter's Galilean moons, known for its volcanic activity and colorful surface.

moons.name: Europa
moons.description: Another of Jupiter's Galilean moons, believed to have a subsurface ocean.

moons.name: Titan
moons.description: Saturn's largest moon, with a dense atmosphere and methane lakes.

moons.name: Titania
moons.description: Uranus' largest moon, known for its rugged terrain and impact craters.

moons.name: Triton
moons.description: Neptune's largest moon, notable for its retrograde orbit and geysers.
